item.title: Street and address sign missing, 7th July
item.description:
Following the previous report of the sign being damaged, a new sign has not yet been installed. This is causing a lot of issues as since the removal, couriers are getting lost.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19B, Oakleaze, Elmbridge, Gloucester

item.title: Abandoned roadworks signs, 7th July
item.description:
2 abandoned roadworks signs in same general area. - on A40 Lansdown Road, outside no. 90, adjacent to "Triumph" traffic lights. Leaning against wall. - on Shelburne Road, adjacent to bus stop shelter, not far from A40 Lansdown Road junction. On pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 90, Lansdown Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Very degraded KEEP CLEAR markings, 7th July
item.description:
B4633 Gloucester Road, at junction with Libertus Road. KEEP CLEAR box is very degraded. Lots of line repainting has recently been done in this area, including similar KEEP CLEAR markings at nearby junctions, but this one at Libertus Road junction has been missed, and needs repainting ASAP.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Libertus Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kidnappers lane - safety concerns, 6th July
item.description:
Kidnappers lane has become a thoroughfare for commuter and school traffic in the morning. The road is in poor repair, single pass in places, and drivers often speed down the road rushing in the mornings. Increasingly the road is used by HSL pupils to walk to school, or younger children to Leckhampton C of E school. Near misses are becoming ever more common, and I fear an accident is waiting to occur. As the new housing developments (Miller & Newlands) are completed the problems will only get worse. Please can this issue be reviewed properly before any serious accidents occur.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken, damaged and missing potholes, 6th July
item.description:
3 drains in the cat park outside Meadow Lea. Council should know where this is, because I'm certain I'm not the first person to report it. I've seen this reported 3 or 4 times in the last 2 years. This has been a issue for almost 3 years, since Jan 2023.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Meadow Lea, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
